page.title: 07TRANSPORT
page.content:
{ TRANSPORT IN LEIGH AND BRANSFORD
An independent{'bus service, operating from Bromyard, goes daily to and from Worcester, with stops on both the Alfrick and Suckley Roads. The public 'bus service operates between Hereford and Worcester along the A4103 road. However, the services are infrequent and the latest service returning from Worcester is six p.m. Consequently people rely heavily upon {private transport}and most families own at least one car.
The{Great Western Railway}built a line between Worcester and Leominster and there was a station at Leigh. It fell under the 'Beeching Axe' in the 1960's and the line dismantled, though its path is still clearly evident.
